page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: At the turn of the 19th century industrial expansion brought many workers to Normanton increasing the population.To meet the public needs schools,shops,housing,chapels etc were built.Today there is evidence of the buildings programme that took place during that era,many High street buildings display date stones of that period. (***BUILDINGS ON/NEAR HIGH STREET** BAPTIST CHAPEL (1877 )LIBRARY (1906 ASSEMBLY ROOMS (1888 )SHOPS (1885 EMPIRE CINEMA (1886 )BATHS (1926 MARKET ARCADE (1901 )SHOPS (1914 METHODIST CHAPEL (1906 )CHAPEL (1858 (********* DATED HOUSES ************** THE POPLARS ((CHURCH LANE) 1907 WOODBINE VILLAS ((CHURCH LANE) 1894 BLENHEIM TERRACE ((KING STREET) 1901 LOWER STATION ROAD (1904 QUEEN STREET SCHOOL (1890
